title: SCP-5900
content:
[[include theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include component:rso]]
[[include theme:redtape years=21]]
[[include :smlt:mrpines:discord-include]]

[[module CSS]]
/* add separator between image and caption */
.block-center img {
    border-bottom: .0625rem solid rgb(var(--swatch-primary-darkest));
}

/* add gap on top of addendum images */
.addendum .scp-image-block {
    margin-top: 0.5em;
}

/* this and the below include are for chat logs */
.memberbot {
    color: #ccc;
}

    color: #e40;
}

    color: #1f1;
}

.member3 {
    color: #a38;
}

    color: #99f;
}

    color: #0be;
}

    color: #906;
}

.memberbot:hover,
.member1:hover,
.member2:hover,
.member3:hover,
.member4:hover,
.member5:hover,
.member6:hover {
    cursor: pointer;
    text-decoration: underline;
}

.memberbot:active,
.member1:active,
.member2:active,
.member3:active,
.member4:active,
.member5:active,
.member6:active {
    background-color: #99f;
    border-radius: 4px;
}

[[include component:info-ayers
    lang=en |
    page=scp-5900 |
    authorPage=https://scpwiki.com/aismallard |
   comments= 
**SCP-5900:** PITCHBLACK  
**Author:** [[*user aismallard]] 
 
**Thanks to:** 
* wctaiwan 
* fluffywaffles 
* [[*user rounderhouse]] 
* [[*user yossipossi]] 
* [[*user modulum]] 
* [[*user Captain Kirby]] 
* [[*user Lambda Fairy]] 
 
Additional appreciation to [[*user rounderhouse]] for help during the drafting process, and allowing me to write for his canon. 
]]

[[include component:anomaly-class-bar-source
    item-number=5900 |
    clearance=3 |
    container-class=pending |
    secondary-class=none
]]

----

[[div class="scp-image-block block-center"]]
[[image outage.png]]
[[div class="scp-image-caption" style="width: 100%;"]]
Service availability during SCP-5900.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

----

**Special Containment Procedures:** RAISA's Surveillance Division is determining the cause of SCP-5900 (ticket #E4K07U2) and creating technical countermeasures to reduce the severity of a similar event in the future (ticket #30VNI4F). The SCP-5900 Containment Director is assigning technicians to replace all damaged components and investigate suspect auxiliaries.

The Department of Internal Security has opened an investigation. [DATA REDACTED 5/INTSEC]

**Description:** SCP-5900 was an outage of PANOPTICON, lasting for five days from 2022/05/19 12:15 to 2022/05/24 21:20 UTC. During this time, surveillance satellites, Site-07 communications, intelligence processing, and IntSCPFN file sync were inoperable. The full extent and nature of the anomaly are presently unknown.

@@@@

-----

[[=]]
++ Addendum 5900.1
+++ {{PANOPTICON PROJECT BRIEF}}
[[/=]]
----
[[collapsible hideLocation="both" show="▶OPEN ADDENDUM◀" hide="▷CLOSE◁"]]
[[div class="addendum"]]
**Project #:** RAISA-31409

**Authorized By:** Overseer Council

PANOPTICON refers to a number of interconnected technological and paratechnological constructs, which collectively enable global oversight.

The Atreus Satellite Array is a Foundation-launched fleet of modular satellites, with orbits configured to ensure full coverage of the Earth at all times. Each satellite has a surveillance installation (see 4/PANOPTICON/HDW04 for schematics), including X-ray antennas and Kant receivers. They also have several hardpoints for weapons and reality anchor attachments, set at the direction of the Department of Applied Force.

[[include component:image-block
    name=relay.jpeg |
    caption=Relay installed at the base of a streetlamp |
    width=200px
]]

Additionally, the Department of Applied Influence's Field Monitoring Division is responsible for the installation and maintenance of over ██ million input devices, including SEP-shielded cameras, microphones, links into existing civilian and government surveillance systems, thaumaturgic particle detectors, and Kant counters.

All gathered surveillance information is processed at Site-07, located in the Norton Bay off the coast of Alaska. Due to its secure location and increasing role in [[[scp-6781|Foundation archival operations]]], it was established as the headquarters of RAISA in 1970. Fifteen years later, the DEEPWELL backup system entered service there as well.

[[include component:image-block
    name=site-07.jpeg |
    caption=Protected Site-07
]]

Records are loaded into an anomalous RDBMS (relational database management system) and indexed accordingly. SKYEYE.aic continuously queries this database to look for correlations or abnormalities which may indicate potential extranormal events, objects, or activity by groups of interest.

On 19██/12/12 a thaumaturgic ritual was performed at the direction of the Overseer Council, resulting in metaphysical anchoring constructs being embedded within areas of the infosphere associated with the Foundation, normalcy, and knowledge.

As information is duplicated throughout all PANOPTICON nodes with at least three parallel processing sites each, an extended outage is extremely improbable. Combined with the anchoring constructs, the calculated probability of an outage is less than 1 in 10^^24^^.

All components of the metaphysical anchoring system were found to be active during SCP-5900.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
----

[[=]]
++ Addendum 5900.2
+++ {{SERVICE LOGS}}
[[/=]]
----
[[collapsible hideLocation="both" show="▶OPEN ADDENDUM◀" hide="▷CLOSE◁"]]
[[div class="addendum"]]
The following is a selection of log events submitted to the Site-07 governance mainframe at the incidence of SCP-5900.

||~ Timestamp ||~ Level ||~ Service ||~ Message ||
|| 16:58:52 || **##green|INFO##** || I/O-BLUE || Initiating automatic containment of thaumaturgic javascript. ||
|| 16:58:55 || **##green|INFO##** || SCUTTLE || Successfully pinged Site-28. ||
|| 16:58:57 || **##e69500|WARN##** || KEENEYE.aic || Text transcription appeared to change. Flagging as potential infohazard. ||
|| 16:59:00 || **##green|INFO##** || LINGUIST.aic || Updating anomalous terms dictionary. (v3.1.18 -> v3.1.19) ||
|| 16:59:00 || **##green|INFO##** || IntSCPFN || Uploading 12 new files from SCP-CN. ||
|| 16:59:02 || **##e69500|WARN##** || Site-07 Oceanic Sensors || Camera 2B damaged or disconnected. ||
|| 16:59:02 || **##green|INFO##** || SKYEYE.aic || Established tracking of PoI-4339. ||
|| 16:59:05 || **##green|INFO##** || COMMAND.aic || Scaling down site-status-mon workers due to inactivity. ||
|| 16:59:06 || **##e69500|WARN##** || SCUTTLE || Unable to ping Site-952. Retrying in 600 seconds. ||
|| 16:59:07 || **##green|INFO##** || LINGUIST.aic || 12 new files successfully translated from Chinese. ||
|| 16:59:11 || **##e69500|WARN##** || SCUTTLE || Unable to ping Site-17. Retrying in 600 seconds. ||
|| 16:59:13 || **##e69500|WARN##** || Site-07 Networking || High latency over thaumic shortwave radio. ||
|| 16:59:15 || **##e69500|WARN##** || SKYEYE.aic || Lost surveillance of 11590 entities. ||
|| 16:59:16 || **##e69500|WARN##** || IntSCPFN || Connection pool failure (4 out of 32). ||
|| 16:59:23 || **##red|ERROR##** || Site-07 Networking || No link to thaumic shortwave relays. ||
|| 16:59:26 || **##e69500|WARN##** || IntSCPFN || Connection pool failure (32 out of 32). ||
|| 16:59:26 || **##red|ERROR##** || I/O-MANDELA || Cannot connect to server! ||
|| 16:59:26 || **##red|ERROR##** || I/O-SILVER || Cannot connect to server! ||
|| 16:59:26 || **##red|ERROR##** || I/O-PHOENIX || Cannot connect to server! ||
|| 16:59:26 |||||| (31 similar entries omitted) ||
|| 16:59:28 || **##red|ALERT##** || Site-07 System Monitor || Service DOWN: intscpfn-server ||
|| 16:59:32 || **##green|INFO##** || COMMAND.aic || Rebooting unhealthy intscpfn-server pods. ||
|| 16:59:35 || **##e69500|WARN##** || SKYEYE.aic || Unable to query surveillance data: Connection refused. ||
|| 16:59:41 || **##red|ALERT##** || Site-07 Communications || Lost contact with Area-25B, Site-104, Site-11, (... 49 total facilities). ||
|| 16:59:58 || **##green|INFO##** || Atreus Satellite Service || Sending 291 new observation updates to Site-07. ||
|| 16:59:58 || **##red|ERROR##** || Atreus Satellite Service || [1]    94182 segmentation fault (core dumped)  /usr/bin/satlink ||
|| 17:00:03 || **##e69500|WARN##** || Webcrawler Service || All bots are reporting as unhealthy. Terminating and restarting. ||
|| 17:00:07 || **##green|INFO##** || COMMAND.aic || Restarting unhealthy atreus-sync and atreus-spy pods. ||
|| 17:00:12 || **##red|ERROR##** || Webcrawler Service || Traceback (most recent call last):   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packag[MESSAGE TOO LONG]  ||
|| 17:02:18 || **##red|ALERT##** || Site-07 System Monitor || Service DOWN: atreus-sat ||
|| 17:02:10 || **##green|INFO##** || COMMAND.aic || All Atreus management daemons are failing to initialize. Attempting rollback to commit 657cf3e... ||
|| 17:02:19 || **##red|ERROR##** || LINGUIST.aic || [DATA LOST] ||
|| 17:02:19 || **##green|INFO##** || COMMAND.aic || Detected memory corruption in LINGUIST container d8410d36. Terminating instance. ||
|| 17:02:22 || **##red|ERROR##** || Site-07 Backups || Failover disk SSD-L3-B09813-48 found to be corrupt. ||
|| 17:02:45  || **##red|ALERT##** || Site-07 Communications || Lost contact with Area-79, Site-81, Site-19, (... 25 total facilities). ||
|| 17:03:05 || **##red|ALERT##** || COMMAND.aic || Declaring extensive outage. Contacting RAISA command. ||
|| 17:03:05 || **##teal|DEBUG##** || COMMAND.aic || todo(jtaylor): this should never happen, refactor later ||
|| 17:03:09 || **##e69500|WARN##** || COMMAND.aic || Filing incident report, recommending as potential anomaly. ||
|| 17:03:12 || **##red|ALERT##** || Site-07 Security || Declaring Priority-A lockdown due to technical outage. ||
|| 17:04:00 || **##green|INFO##** || Site-07 Weather Service || Condition: clear skies. No forecasted storms for 6 hours. ||
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
----

[[=]]
++ Addendum 5900.3
+++ {{INTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS}}
[[/=]]
----
[[collapsible hideLocation="both" show="▶OPEN ADDENDUM◀" hide="▷CLOSE◁"]]
[[div class="addendum chat"]]
The following are selections from engineering ROMP[[footnote]]RAISA Online Messaging Platform, a extension of RFC 1459 (Internet Relay Chat Protocol) designed to exhibit resistance against infohazards and manage classified information in a secure manner.[[/footnote]] channels at Site-07 during SCP-5900.

> Excerpt: Day 1, 4:17 AM (local time)

> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] morning graveyard shift people
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] hey terry
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] hey, what's up
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] got a bit of a headache, you?
> = [[span class="member5"]]rhill[[/span]] uploaded file: [[span class="click"]]1560131817.jpg ⬇[[/span]]
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] pffft
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] made me almost spurt coffee out of my nose lol
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] mission accomplished :D
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] .rebuild supply-service
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Starting build #839057 for supply-service
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] [[span class="member4"]]lgonzales[[/span]]: you adjusted the config already, right?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] yeah i did
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] sweet
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: webcrawler-service is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: intscpfn-server is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: intscpfn-node is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: communications is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: slot-service is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: bridge-aic is DEGRADED
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: relay-service is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: backup-service is DEGRADED
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: poi-service is DOWN
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] what the fuck
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: message-service is DEGRADED
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: intel-storage-service is DOWN
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: skyeye-aic is DEGRADED
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] can someone stop it from spamming
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: linguist-aic is DOWN
> = //[[span class="member3"]]jtaylor[[/span]] kicked [[span class="memberbot"]]raisa-bot[[/span]].//
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] I'll look and see what's wrong with the bot
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] uh why is the site locking down? is there a drill?
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] wtf
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] the python webcrawlers are actually broken
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] no way
> = **Lost external network access. Switching ROMP to site-only.**
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] yeah I can't connect to the panopticon spy nodes. something's up
> = //[[span class="memberbot"]]raisa-bot[[/span]] has joined.//
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] COMMAND.aic broadcast: Extensive outage in effect. RAISA command has been notified.
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] fuck.

----

> Excerpt: Day 1, 6:41 AM

> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] all right, so here's how management has decided to set this up
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] team A will look through the broken services
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] team B goes through all our deploys
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] team C looks at the metabed anchor system
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] classifications are still in force, so please report any unintentional contact with level-4/5 intel
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] sounds good, I'll take filesync
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] [[span class="member3"]]jtaylor[[/span]]: isn't there a provisional scp for this incident?
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] uh yes, there should be. I don't see it though
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] the local database was in the middle of a sync and got corrupted
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] command.aic wasn't able to save the provisional skip anywhere
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] can we just roll it back?
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] yeah, give me a moment
> = [[span class="member1"]]jjohnson[[/span]] uploaded file: [[span class="click"]]scp-report-1560142360.ftml ⬇[[/span]]
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] wow, why was it given "scp-5900"?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] i guess we've never had a slot-assign outage before lol
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] okay, so we can see all the satellites above us, but just can't connect for some reason
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] we can connect directly, right?
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] yes. big pain in the arse though
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] actually jim has a script to help with that. lemme see
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] the technicians just finished inspecting the shortwave radio antennas. doesn't look like there's any damage
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] that's good at least
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] so we're pretty sure it's a software or configuration problem
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] hey all, I was able to connect to satellite atreus-48. status normal, no connections to other sites
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] no extraterrestrial abnormalities
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] upload the report here?
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] sure, give me a sec
> = [[span class="member5"]]rhill[[/span]] uploaded file: [[span class="click"]]atreus-48-events.log ⬇[[/span]]
> = [[span class="member5"]]rhill[[/span]] uploaded file: [[span class="click"]]atreus-48-space.ftml ⬇[[/span]]
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] the ground data is loading really slow, but nothing weird so far
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] why do we care about surface readings? don't we just want connection logs?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] we don't know if this is a k-class
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] oh

----

> Excerpt: Day 2, 4:38 PM

> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] man this thaumaturgy link code is really hard to understand
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] I know it's old, but it's not *that* bad, is it?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] oh it's fine, I just forgot how hard it is to wrap your head around this stuff lol
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] you went to ICSUT, right? did you take that paratemporal networking class?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] [[span class="member1"]]jjohnson[[/span]] indeed. consuming packets before you've sent them was the hardest part for me
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] how are the satellite systems looking? the links have been operable for hours but the system still can't do the handshake
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] I'm really not sure. I've been running local experiments and they work fine, but once we plug into the real system it fails
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] maybe something wrong with our thaumic keys?
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] hmm. will be hard to make new ones though, given the lack of communications here
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] this is interesting
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] so metabed has several conceptual hooks for protecting our systems, right
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] all of them are "latched on" so to speak, but a few aren't "transferring"?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] the model is weird, if you know about alpha-lambda loops you know what I'm talking about
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] what how? there aren't many declassified docs but
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] that is only possible if the originator decides to decouple iirc
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] which I *highly* doubt the O5s would do
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] I know, it's bizarre
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] maybe a third party tried to take it from us?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] nah, it would require way too much energy
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] though I think looking at swapping out conceptual targets is a possibility. [[span class="member3"]]jtaylor[[/span]] can you get me access to the 5/metabed ritual info?
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] I'll see what I can do

----

> Excerpt: Day 5, 1:08 PM

> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] The administrative liaison is saying you can formulate a new thaumic unit, but it can't be overlapping with the originals
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] wtf? my plan doesn't, it attaches to uniq-418ef and uniq-0a341
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] tell them to just give me the full fucking plans and they can amnesticize me after
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] I've already told you that isn't going to happen
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] this is such bullshit
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] fundamental rituals are always safeguarded the most
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] [[span class="member1"]]jjohnson[[/span]] I didn't ask you
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] sorry, that was uncalled for
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] I think we can at least restore the satellite connections with conceptual positioning
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] those plans would be helpful there at least
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] to be honest, I don't even believe the documentation. it claims they attach to "the concept of knowledge"
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] but I doubt it. that's too fundamental, they probably just got some "sending data" side-stream. way easier to do
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] and it would explain why it being interrupted fucked all our comms
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] is it interrupted?
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] what else could it be? it's not broken or the system would've repaired and it's not detached since I just checked
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] [[span class="member4"]]lgonzales[[/span]]: some good news. maria jones is stepping in and giving us access to the ritual plans
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] don't burn me here, we better get something substantial from this
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] oh thank god
> = [[span class="member3"]]jtaylor[[/span]] uploaded file: [[span class="click"]][DATA REDACTED 5/PANOPTICON] ⬇[[/span]]
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] holy shit, look at that
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] god damn they weren't lying
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] we can fix this now. [[span class="member5"]]rhill[[/span]] you have that great ritual autoexecutor tool, right?
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] it's standard now, renamed to "thaumexec"
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] excellent
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] so let's reconfigure on the main anchor points, with the proposed backups
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] just started it
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] uh guys, the monitor is saying the network has abnormally high input?
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: communications is UP
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] wait
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] the system is working again?
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: bridge-aic is UP
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: linguist-aic is RECOVERING
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: intscpfn-server is UP
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: intscpfn-node is UP
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] holy shit it worked!
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: slot-service is UP
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: relay-service is UP
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] :D
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: webcrawler-service is UP
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] Monitor: backup-service is UP
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] we're getting atreus update events. looks like things are starting to flow again
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] good work everybody

[!--
List of names:
> [[span class="memberbot"]]<raisa-bot>[[/span]] 
> [[span class="member1"]]<jjohnson>[[/span]] 
> [[span class="member2"]]<tscott>[[/span]] 
> [[span class="member3"]]<jtaylor>[[/span]] 
> [[span class="member4"]]<lgonzales>[[/span]] 
> [[span class="member5"]]<rhill>[[/span]] 
--]
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
----

[[=]]
++ Addendum 5900.4
+++ {{RECOVERY UPDATE}}
[[/=]]
----
[[collapsible hideLocation="both" show="▶OPEN ADDENDUM◀" hide="▷CLOSE◁"]]
[[div class="addendum"]]
Critical services began recovering at 2022/05/24 21:09 UTC, after which the PANOPTICON metaphysical anchoring system automatically recalibrated itself. An inspection discovered an unusual HTML payload in one of the anchor's logs. A screenshot has been attached below:

[[div_ class="aligncenter" style="border: 1px solid #999;"]]
[[image ;-).png]]
[[/div]]

The origin and meaning of this notice is unclear. Investigation is ongoing.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

----

[[footnoteblock]]

[[div class="rnb-navbar"]]
[[div class="rnb-item rnb-last"]]
[[a href="/scp-6781" style="display: block;"]][[span class="rnb-supertitle"]]PREVIOUS[[/span]]
